com.tofik.coolexoplayer.exoplayer

Class ExoPlayable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tofik.coolexoplayer.exoplayer.ExoPlayable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Playable

    public class ExoPlayable
extends java.lang.Object
    Making Playable extensible. This can be used with custom ExoCreator. Extending this class must make sure the re-usability of the implementation.
    Since:
    3.4.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.tofik.coolexoplayer.exoplayer.Playable

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        public void prepare(boolean prepareSource)
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Prepare the resource for a SimpleExoPlayer. This method should: - Request for new SimpleExoPlayer instance if there is not a usable one. - Configure Playable.EventListener for it. - If there is non-trivial PlaybackInfo, update it to the SimpleExoPlayer. - If client request to prepare MediaSource, then prepare it. This method must be called before Playable.setPlayerView(PlayerView).
        Specified by:
        prepare in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        prepareSource - if true, also prepare the MediaSource when preparing the Player, if false just do nothing for the MediaSource.

      • setPlayerView

        public void setPlayerView(@Nullable
                          com.google.android.exoplayer2.ui.PlayerView playerView)
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Set the PlayerView for this Playable. It is expected that a playback doesn't require a UI, so this setup is optional. But it must be called after the SimpleExoPlayer is prepared, that is after Playable.prepare(boolean) and before Playable.release(). Changing the PlayerView during playback is expected, though not always recommended, especially on old Devices with low Android API.
        Specified by:
        setPlayerView in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        playerView - the PlayerView to set to the SimpleExoPlayer.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Reset all resource, so that the playback can start all over again. This is to cleanup the playback for reuse. The SimpleExoPlayer instance must be still usable without calling Playable.prepare(boolean).
        Specified by:
        reset in interface Playable

      • release

        public void release()
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Release all resource. After this, the SimpleExoPlayer is released to the Player pool and the Playable must call Playable.prepare(boolean) again to use it again.
        Specified by:
        release in interface Playable

                                        PlaybackInfo playbackInfo,

        Description copied from interface: Playable

      • addEventListener

        public final void addEventListener(@NonNull
                                   Playable.EventListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Add a new Playable.EventListener to this Playable. As calling Playable.prepare(boolean) also triggers some internal events, this method should be called before Playable.prepare(boolean) so that Client could received them all.
        Specified by:
        addEventListener in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        listener - the EventListener to add, must be not null.

      • removeEventListener

        public final void removeEventListener(Playable.EventListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Remove an Playable.EventListener from this Playable.
        Specified by:
        removeEventListener in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        listener - the EventListener to be removed. If null, nothing happens.
